oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Leon McAuliffe and his Western Swing Band (KVOO) - 1949-06-17
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: KVOO, Tulsa, OK radio program of Leon McAuliffe and his Western Swing Band (however Leon is away on a personal appearance), including Bob Bruce (fiddle, vocals), and Jimmy Hall (fiddle, vocals). Originally broadcast 1949-06-17 at 12:15 pm (CST). Sponsored by Nutrena, with announcer Walter Teas. It is announced that Leon McAuliffe and host Johnny Ryan should be back by Saturday (1949-06-18).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Western Swing Band (Leon McAuliffe)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Opening statement (Walter Teas) -- Opening theme (Steel Guitar Rag) -- Nutrena jingle -- Walter Teas introduces Bob Bruce -- Twin Fiddle Rag (Bob Bruce fiddle, Jimmy Hall fiddle, Western Swing Band) -- Bob Bruce talks -- Nutrena commercial (Walter Teas) -- Tennessee Border (Jimmy Hall vocals, Western Swing Band) -- Walter Teas and Bob Bruce talk -- Walter Teas announces the band's appearance schedule -- Room Full Of Roses (Bob Bruce vocals, Western Swing Band) -- Walter Teas reads listener requests -- The Lonesome Hearted Blues (Jimmy Hall vocals, Western Swing Band) -- Nutrena commercial (Walter Teas) -- Closing theme -- Closing statement (Walter Teas) -- Nutrena jingle
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: KVOO (Radio station : Tulsa, Okla.); Teas, Walter; Western Swing Band (Musical group : Leon McAuliffe); Hall, Jimmy, 1921-; Bruce, Bob
